title: Prefigurative Community Building (Part 38): Digital Security Pods - Power With in the Age of Surveillance
summary: A guide to forming small groups that support each other in digital security practices, sharing tools and knowledge through mutual aid rather than expert gatekeeping.

Communication.summary: Build secure communication practices and digital safety networks that protect community organizing and personal autonomy.

level0: Form a small digital security pod with 3-6 trusted people
Share digital life maps and identify security concerns together
Practice basic digital hygiene like password managers and two-factor authentication
level1: Establish pod agreements for learning together without shame or judgment
Focus on one security topic at a time (messaging, passwords, app permissions)
Create rapid response plans for digital emergencies like hacking or doxxing
level2: Host digital security workshops for broader community
Build networks with other digital security pods for mutual support
Practice advanced security techniques like encrypted communications and secure storage
level3: Support formation of additional autonomous digital security pods
Advocate for community-controlled technology and digital rights
Build lasting infrastructure for grassroots digital security education

Knowledge.summary: Share digital security knowledge horizontally while building community capacity for technological self-defense.

level0: Learn about digital surveillance and privacy threats affecting your community
Study successful digital security organizing like Cryptoparty movement
level1: Practice teaching digital security skills in accessible, non-technical language
Document your pod's learning process and security practices
Learn trauma-informed approaches to discussing surveillance and digital threats
level2: Create zines and resources about community digital security organizing
Host skill-shares on digital security tools and practices
Share knowledge with other security pods and privacy organizers
level3: Develop comprehensive digital security organizing toolkits
Research and document community approaches to technological self-defense
Train facilitators in other communities starting digital security pods

Power.summary: Challenge surveillance capitalism and state monitoring while building community power through collective digital security.

level0: Practice digital security as community care and mutual protection
Challenge narratives that normalize surveillance and data extraction
Build analysis of how digital security relates to broader liberation struggles
level1: Organize community members to collectively resist digital surveillance
Practice digital civil disobedience and technological resistance
Build collective capacity to protect vulnerable community members online
level2: Coordinate digital security organizing with other social justice work
Challenge policies and systems that enable mass surveillance
Build political power through grassroots digital rights organizing
level3: Contribute to broader movements for digital justice and technological sovereignty
Build lasting infrastructure for collective digital self-determination
